body:
List of supported Analytics Frameworks

Parse
Flurry
Google Analytics 
Kissmetrics 
Mixpanel 
Woopra
Heapanalytics
Segment

Ability to detect.
Implemented in #17.
Skin parser tests are done with #22.
@toygard Just a reminder for your future branches, please keep in mind that feature branches are prefixed with "feature/". So the name of this branch should have been "feature/youtube-support".

I have merged master onto this branch  as Swift style enforcing via SwiftLint has been added to it. Please run the following command on your local machine so the run script phase doesn't cause a build error.

```
brew install swiftlint
```
@toygard Merged it. Please check the last two commits I made when you have the time.
Updated issue details.

API for adding timed overlays should be similar to the following:

``` swift
playerVC.showOverlayViewController(bannerVC, startingAtTime: 2, forDuration: 6) 
```

So that more than one `OverlayViewController` can be shown.
@toygard The review-needed label shouldn't be added to a WIP pull request.
The test process began for all functions
@toygard You don't need to label pull requests as bug/enhancement/etc. Only review and progress labels should be used on PRs.
@toygard Have you checked what we talked about?
@isair Now I can control..
Required to write tests in this section, the work function of the video test, but the video does not play, so I have to search for the video test
JW Player documentation http://bit.ly/1GVHqhN

Volume control hide/show seems to be not working properly.

![ios simulator screen shot jun 29 2015 11 50 46 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/988213/8425416/632067dc-1eba-11e5-86d5-68c08715bf69.png)

![ios simulator screen shot jun 29 2015 11 50 51 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/988213/8425354/d64e92d4-1eb9-11e5-941d-ed2f6018a294.png)

While I haven't opened the volume control, it automatically appeared itself when I tapped the screen to hide the controls.
https://guides.cocoapods.org/making/making-a-cocoapod.html
Closing as duplicate of #18.
CircleCI seems to fail. Also these tests aren't correct, let's go over how you need to write them tomorrow morning.

- Data URL: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CocoaPods/Specs/0a4cf97dd2bd7cd5e8655bd1567fb1e9e1635c8c/Specs/MobilePlayer/0.0.2/MobilePlayer.podspec.json
  - Log messages:
    - July 1st, 22:42: Push for `MobilePlayer 0.0.2' initiated.
    - July 1st, 22:42: Push for `MobilePlayer 0.0.2' has been pushed (1.469524795 s).
Completed video playback functionality.
@toygard I removed the `enhancement` label. Don't forget; you shouldn't label PRs as enhancement or bug.
@isair seem ok to me. For history , we are only keeping last 2 right? There is no need to keep all the history of 10 minute video. Last 2 history should be enough.
@sahin Then what about having `state` and `previousState` instead of holding an array?
@isair yep, that make sense way more. u guys can ask what were the edge cases that we had in web player

@sahin @toygard I'll update my original proposal then. You'll know that it's updated when you see `state` and `previousState` in it.

Edit: Done.
@toygard Looks fine, I'll approve this once tests are working. We also need to define SnapKit as a dependency of the MobilePlayer pod but I'll create a separate issue for it later.
@toygard I have updated the issue description with the required changes.
@toygard What is this?
@toygard The review label you have added is wrong, you need to add review-needed. needs-revision means rejection.

@toygard Basically we should improve the example app. The first screen of the example app should be a list of styles (a UITableViewController should be used); when a style is tapped a player view controller with that style should pop and a video should start playing.
Closing as duplicate of #8.

@sahin @toygard This is acceptable. But we already have a function for adding overlays. Instead of defining a separate logoView, that function should be used. I'll refactor this myself after all tasks are done for 1.0.0.
@toygard We need to have a call about this. This isn't the button action mechanism we discussed.
@toygard Could you also remove shareCallback from the config structure like we talked?

- Hides status bar (default: true)
- Interface hiding time (default: 2 seconds)
- Interface update time (default: 0.25 seconds)
Closed as duplicate of #78.

<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Sorry to inform that it was taken out of the project before the 1.0.0 release. We believe it is better if people use other libraries for parsing video file URLs from pages of video hosting sites, as trying to support that increases the scope of this project significantly and adds a lot of maintenance burden.

EDIT: I ran into the following library today https://github.com/hellozimi/HCYoutubeParser
@isair we already have one. https://github.com/movielala/YoutubeSourceParserKit

@sahin 
I actually like VKVideoPlayer
But to enumerate a few issues:
- It's not that easy to Customize not because of the lack of features, on the contrary, because it is now too complicated
- It lacks certain iOS 9 features (Most notably PiP viki-org/VKVideoPlayer#49 )
- Apple has some issues with the name space itself ( viki-org/VKVideoPlayer#64 )
- The repo is not Maintained anymore

But, to be fair, they have notified us that they are working on a swift version with a 2-3 weeks ETA as of yesterday.

I use `.srt` subtitles currently and it'll be a great feature for the library anyway IMHO.
@ReadmeCritic thx man.

@sahin Yes, I do. The app makes heavy use of Storyboard and [IBAnimatable](https://github.com/JakeLin/IBAnimatable). With two features: Storyboard Reference and Container View, make it easy for me to compose UI.
:smile:

As you said you can define a configuration with just top bar customization in it where it has a close button and a title label, but not an action button. If you don't want to do that, you can also hide the button view manually using `playerVC.getViewForElementWithIdentifier("action")?.hidden = true`.

However, you have made a good point; it makes sense to hide it when `activityItems` are nil. It's added to the roadmap now.

@jacks205 thank you so much. 

@isair can u check and merge it?

_[MobilePlayer/MobilePlayerViewController.swift, line 340 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/mobileplayer/mobileplayer-ios/121#-KBH0MQJtO_w5nduAUE3:-KBH0MQJtO_w5nduAUE4:-748862497) ([raw file](https://github.com/mobileplayer/mobileplayer-ios/blob/1dd6f7c79ee31a6a3ca0a87fc177d7c7cd3803c7/MobilePlayer/MobilePlayerViewController.swift#L340)):_
You're adding another callback for the `.TouchUpInside` event every time the `activityItems` change and is not empty. I believe leaving the callback attachment in the initialization and just changing `actionButton.hidden` when `activityItems` change is what should be done.

---

<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->
Checked. Thanks for your contribution @jacks205. The code needs to be edited a bit but I'll do that and merge it.
This will probably happen after we switch from using MediaPlayer framework to AVFoundation, as storyboards have an _AVKit Player View Controller_ item you can drag and drop.
PiP support will be added after #77.

You can add an event handler to it just like you would add to any button. You can get the close button view by using `playerVC.viewForElementWithIdentifier("close") as? UIButton`.

**Edit** Take a look at the documentation for more information. You can also check these parts in the source code: [ElementConfig](https://github.com/mobileplayer/mobileplayer-ios/blob/master/MobilePlayer/Config/ElementConfig.swift#L49), [MobilePlayerViewController](https://github.com/mobileplayer/mobileplayer-ios/blob/master/MobilePlayer/MobilePlayerViewController.swift#L395).

@wfreytag-sport1 thx

@isair any comments?

You should be able to do it. `MobilePlayerViewController` extends `MPMoviePlayerViewController` and doesn't touch the layout of its main view. Let me know if you're having issues and post a part of your code that is not working if possible.

Did work, but i could not performe a segue, as i set for "close"

`performSegueWithIdentifier("mySegue", sender: self)`,

for now i did used a work around with `NSUserDefaults` and `viewDidAppear` but would be great to know how to performe a segue on the click if you could help.

        let videoURL = NSURL(string: "http://test.d.sambavideos.sambatech.com/account/100209/1/2012-05-04/video/4b3b76a5d1698cd185bc2d84db3a11a2/Rango_-_Trailer__HD_1080p_.mp4")!

@ThiagoMiranda super thank you, very detailed. 

I will forward the error to our main engineer @isair , he will check it asap.
@isair , can u check?
Are you adding the view controller as a child view controller?

Thanks for the reply. @sahin and @isair 

For the first question for some reason when I did a refactor on my code ( initializing all of the project again ) and it worked. We don't seem to have the answer why this happened yet but it's working so be it =p
For the second one I'm using:

``` swift
        notificationCenter.addObserverForName(
            MPMoviePlayerPlaybackStateDidChangeNotification,
            object: player.moviePlayer,
            queue: NSOperationQueue.mainQueue()) { notification in
                switch player.state {
                case .Playing:
                    eventType = "play"
                case .Paused:
                    eventType = "pause"
                case .Buffering:
                    eventType = "buffer"
                default:
                    break
                }
        }
```

Can I make two quick questions?
1- Do you have a "fullscreen" button? If it does, how can I show it? Or at least how can I trigger a fullscreen event? I've tried 

``` swift
    player.moviePlayer.setFullscreen(true, animated: false)
```

but it shows a black screen and pauses the video.

2- We wanna put a play and pause button right on the middle of the screen like this:
![captura de tela 2016-03-17 as 17 19 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/141922/13859900/8f958176-ec64-11e5-8481-f27c59cf324a.png)
Do you guys have a "nice way" to do that or would be necessary to edit the framework itself?
@seamug we are just a skin overlay on top of ios Video player
@Elyseyvova can u share the url?
@isair can u  confirm?
@isair ?
Sadly we don't have a volume slider component yet. It is in our roadmap. For future reference, you can check all available components from our documentation.
I can't seem to find the sentence you mention in our README. Is it somewhere else?

in this page https://htmlpreview.github.io/?https://github.com/movielala/mobileplayer-ios/blob/master/Documentation/index.html . 

This page not found https://github.com/mobileplayer/mobileplayer-ios/blob/master/MobilePlayerExample/Skin/Netflix.json
Documentation's index.html is just the README file from when the documentation was generated. It's been outdated a little due to issues with the documentation generator.

@leo150 of course. 

http://mobileplayer.io/pricing/
it is free, use it as you want. 

I am bad in licensing :), which licensing you think we should you.

We don't have APIs specifically designed to do those, but everything you have mentioned is perfectly doable. `MPMoviePlayerController` has an `initialPlaybackTime` property which you can use. As for saving the last played time, just hold the time value in a variable on close and pass it when playing again.

Glad it's working! As for your questions

1) Sadly, we don't have a fullscreen button at the moment. If you replace our player view controller with a standard `MPMoviePlayerViewController` and you're not having this black screen issue, then it's certainly a bug and a separate issue for it should be created.

2) You can create an overlay with a play/pause button in it, then add it as a pre-roll and pause overlay.

Hi, thanks for response 

http://mobileplayer.io/pricing/ conflicts with https://github.com/mobileplayer/mobileplayer-ios#license because products covered by Creative Commons can't be used in _commercial_ app. 

May you cover free part of mobileplayer with [MIT license](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) like almost all open-source projects and use some commercial license for analytics and monetization?
thanks for the update :-)! :+1:
Any update on this?
We easily reproduce it, @isair was working on it. We will have the fix in the next release. it is in our top list. @isair is on holiday now, we will look into it in 7-10 days.

Thanks for your contribution! :)

Rez

If you really want to remove the warning, Just set the target of your project to 8.X

For a cleaner solution:
You need to use AVPlayer and AVPlayerItem inside MobilePlayerViewController
But you cannot just replace 'MPMoviePlayerViewController' by 'AVPlayerViewController' (its method cannot be overridden)

I implemented AVPlayer inside 'MobilePlayerViewController' in my local project, but will need some time to refact my code before proposing a pull request

Replacing the MPMoviePlayerViewController with AVPlayerLayer is on our
roadmap, but we are busy working on our other products at the moment.
Though any pull requests are most definitely welcome!

Everything works fine for me in an inline container view. I'm using SnapKit to layout player view inside container view.

```swift
let videoURL = URL(string: "http://example.com/movie.mp4")!
let playerVC = MobilePlayerViewController(contentURL: videoURL)
playerVC.title = "Vanilla Player"
UIApplication.shared.keyWindow!.rootViewController?.presentMoviePlayerViewControllerAnimated(playerVC)
playerView.addSubview(playerVC.view)
playerVC.view.snp.makeConstraints { (make) in
    make.edges.equalToSuperview()
}
```
this is good! it's the best answer AFAIK, nice!
Any solution?

@CoolHandLuke88 
If you use Swift 3, than just change
`presentMoviePlayerViewControllerAnimated`
to 
`present(playerVC, animated: true, completion: nil)`

Add this code to your viewDidLoad method inside your ViewController:

Swift 2.2:

```
let playerVC = MobilePlayerViewController(
            contentURL: videoURL,
            config: config,
            prerollViewController: PrerollOverlayViewController(),
            pauseOverlayViewController: PauseOverlayViewController(),
            postrollViewController: PostrollOverlayViewController())

addChildViewController(playerVC)

playerVC.view.frame = playerView.frame
playerVC.didMoveToParentViewController(self)
playerView.addSubview(playerVC.view)  
```

playerView is a subview in your storyboard where you want to display the video

This is an old issue but for those who might see this later i maid the change in `MobilePlayerControlsView.swift` the function is `override func layoutSubviews()`

There is the code : 

```Swift
override func layoutSubviews() {
    let size = bounds.size
    
    var topSafeAreaHeight: CGFloat = 0
    var bottomSafeAreaHeight: CGFloat = 0
    
    if #available(iOS 11.0, *) {
        let window = UIApplication.shared.windows[0]
        let safeFrame = window.safeAreaLayoutGuide.layoutFrame
        topSafeAreaHeight = safeFrame.minY
        bottomSafeAreaHeight = window.frame.maxY - safeFrame.maxY
    }
    
    previewImageView.frame = bounds
    activityIndicatorView.sizeToFit()
    activityIndicatorView.frame.origin = CGPoint(
      x: (size.width - activityIndicatorView.frame.size.width) / 2,
      y: (size.height - activityIndicatorView.frame.size.height) / 2)
    topBar.sizeToFit()
    topBar.frame = CGRect(
      x: 0,
      y: controlsHidden ? -topBar.frame.size.height : topSafeAreaHeight,
      width: size.width,
      height: topBar.frame.size.height)
    topBar.alpha = controlsHidden ? 0 : 1
    bottomBar.sizeToFit()
    bottomBar.frame = CGRect(
      x: 0,
      y: size.height - (controlsHidden ? 0 : bottomBar.frame.size.height + bottomSafeAreaHeight),
      width: size.width,
      height: bottomBar.frame.size.height)
    bottomBar.alpha = controlsHidden ? 0 : 1
    overlayContainerView.frame = CGRect(
      x: 0,
      y: controlsHidden ? 0 : topBar.frame.size.height,
      width: size.width,
      height: size.height - (controlsHidden ? 0 : (topBar.frame.size.height + bottomBar.frame.size.height)))
    for overlay in overlayContainerView.subviews {
      overlay.frame = overlayContainerView.bounds
    }
    super.layoutSubviews()
  }
}
```

I will submit a pull request with that update.

@rico237  I have a simulator too. :( 
In your implementation of landscape mode, it was going into notch, like this - 
![Screenshot 2019-04-03 at 5 36 01 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30552772/55477570-0ba40780-5637-11e9-8056-7936edb3cf40.png)

I solved it using - 
'
override func layoutSubviews() {
        let size = bounds.size

        let iPhoneX = UIDevice().userInterfaceIdiom == .phone && (UIScreen.main.nativeBounds.height == 2436 || UIScreen.main.nativeBounds.height == 1792 || UIScreen.main.nativeBounds.height == 2688)
        let landscape = UIDevice.current.orientation.isLandscape
        var topSafeAreaHeight: CGFloat = 0.0
        var bottomSafeAreaHeight: CGFloat = 0.0

        if #available(iOS 11.0, *) {
            let window = UIApplication.shared.windows[0]
            let safeFrame = window.safeAreaLayoutGuide.layoutFrame
            topSafeAreaHeight = safeFrame.minY
            bottomSafeAreaHeight = window.frame.maxY - safeFrame.maxY
        }

        previewImageView.frame = bounds
        activityIndicatorView.sizeToFit()
        activityIndicatorView.frame.origin = CGPoint(
            x: (size.width - activityIndicatorView.frame.size.width) / 2,
            y: (size.height - activityIndicatorView.frame.size.height) / 2)
        topBar.sizeToFit()
        topBar.frame = CGRect(
            x: (iPhoneX && landscape) ? 44 : 0,
            y: controlsHidden ? -topBar.frame.size.height : topSafeAreaHeight,
            width: size.width - ((iPhoneX && landscape) ? 88 : 0),
            height: topBar.frame.size.height)
        topBar.alpha = controlsHidden ? 0 : 1
        bottomBar.sizeToFit()
        bottomBar.frame = CGRect(
            x: (iPhoneX && landscape) ? 44 : 0,
            y: size.height - (controlsHidden ? 0 : bottomBar.frame.size.height + bottomSafeAreaHeight),
            width: size.width - ((iPhoneX && landscape) ? 88 : 0),
            height: bottomBar.frame.size.height)
        bottomBar.alpha = controlsHidden ? 0 : 1
        overlayContainerView.frame = CGRect(
            x: 0,
            y: controlsHidden ? 0 : topBar.frame.size.height,
            width: size.width,
            height: size.height - (controlsHidden ? 0 : (topBar.frame.size.height + bottomBar.frame.size.height)))
        for overlay in overlayContainerView.subviews {
            overlay.frame = overlayContainerView.bounds
        }
        super.layoutSubviews()
    }
`
